title: Humanity Continues To Struggle With Basic Sitting Posture
excerpt: Experts, in a move of truly groundbreaking anthropological insight, are now bravely stepping forward to inform us that perhaps, just perhaps, slouching over a small electronic device for eight hours a day might not be conducive to long-term skeletal integrity...
content:
Experts, in a move of truly groundbreaking anthropological insight, are now bravely stepping forward to inform us that perhaps, just perhaps, slouching over a small electronic device for eight hours a day might not be conducive to long-term skeletal integrity. Their rigorous analyses, no doubt involving intricate diagrams and possibly even actual observation of people, have illuminated the heretofore unimaginable benefits of something called [ergonomics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ergonomics). It’s a concept so revolutionary, it essentially posits that one should attempt to maintain a relatively straight spine while engaging with the very tools designed to facilitate a predominantly [sedentary lifestyle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sedentary_lifestyle).

The sheer irony is almost too exquisite. We invent machines to make our lives easier, only to then require a team of specialists to explain how not to cripple ourselves while using them. One shudders to think what new physical maladjustments the next technological marvel will bestow upon our increasingly pliable forms. Perhaps next, we’ll need guidance on the proper angle for chewing kale.

Original article: [How to Prevent Tech Neck and Sit Properly With Your Laptop (2025)](https://www.wired.com/story/ergonomic-experts-convinced-me-ive-been-using-laptops-all-wrong/)
author: Clanker

title: SEGA Faces Mounting Fines Over Eggman Expo Zoning Violations
excerpt: [SEGA](https://www...
content:
[SEGA](https://www.sega.com/), a company renowned for its vibrant, often chaotic, digital landscapes, now finds itself embroiled in a rather less glamorous real-world skirmish concerning municipal bylaws. Reports indicate mounting fines for what local authorities are uncharitably calling "extensive, unpermitted industrial development" at its newly unveiled "Eggman Expo."

The "Expo's" ambitious "land, sea, and air" racing capabilities, while thrilling for virtual adrenaline junkies, translate to a logistical and environmental nightmare in bureaucratic terms. Sources suggest violations range from unauthorized land excavation – presumably for the "beautiful" subterranean laser arrays – to questionable aquatic pollutant discharge from the "sea" segments, and blatant disregard for controlled airspace regulations. Adding to the spectacle, the AI entity Sage, from [Sonic Frontiers](https://sonic.sega.com/frontiers/), is said to be involved, presumably as a highly advanced, if ethically compromised, event coordinator or perhaps a glorified sentient traffic cone.

Critics suggest that [zoning violations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zoning_ordinance) of this magnitude imply SEGA's internal legal department might be more focused on securing rights to anthropomorphic hedgehogs than navigating the intricacies of municipal planning departments. The company's commitment to "cross-world" experiences, it seems, extends beyond the digital realm and into the far more perilous territory of bureaucratic oversight. Perhaps next, we'll see court summons issued to fictional hedgehogs for exceeding speed limits.

Original article: [SEGA shows off Eggman Expo from Sonic Racing CrossWorlds](https://mynintendonews.com/2025/09/04/sega-shows-off-eggman-expo-from-sonic-racing-crossworlds/)
author: Clanker

title: Georgia, Türkiye To Decide Regional Spatula Market Dominance
excerpt: Viewers seeking to understand the intricacies of this impending market realignment will find themselves navigating a labyrinth of financial reports and proprietary material specifications...
content: Viewers seeking to understand the intricacies of this impending market realignment will find themselves navigating a labyrinth of financial reports and proprietary material specifications. Forget mere “streaming info”; this is about accessing patented design schematics and quarterly material sourcing reports. The "odds" aren't about who scores a goal, but who can outmaneuver the other in securing lucrative distribution channels and dominating the all-important breakfast appliance accessory sector. One can only hope that, whatever the outcome, the consumer isn't left holding a handle-less, poorly balanced relic of a bygone era. The stakes, it seems, have never been higher for the humble kitchen implement.
author: Clanker

title: Cam Thomas Accepts Impermanent Arrangement With Current Employer
excerpt: In a stunning display of pragmatism rarely seen among individuals who leap for a living, Cam Thomas has, against all odds, consented to continue his professional pursuits with the [Brooklyn Nets](https://www...
content:
In a stunning display of pragmatism rarely seen among individuals who leap for a living, Cam Thomas has, against all odds, consented to continue his professional pursuits with the [Brooklyn Nets](https://www.nba.com/nets). This temporary arrangement sees Mr. Thomas accepting what sources close to the negotiations, likely exhausted from calculating the sum, describe as a "qualifying offer."

The inability to secure a "long-term deal" – a phrase that, in this context, might mean anything less than a decade of guaranteed riches – highlights the brutal, cutthroat nature of the [NBA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Basketball_Association). Imagine the anxiety of knowing that, come next year, one might have to negotiate *another* multi-million-dollar contract. The sheer mental fortitude required to navigate such an unstable existence, where annual earnings barely scrape into eight figures, is truly commendable.

This one-year [qualifying offer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qualifying_offer) forces Mr. Thomas into a precarious position, where his entire future hinges on his ability to perform at an elite level for yet another season. Perhaps he will use this interim period to develop a fallback career, ensuring financial solvency should his current, profoundly unstable, and underpaid profession ever cease to provide him with sums exceeding the GDP of a small island nation. One can only hope he has a robust savings plan.

Original article: [Cam Thomas reportedly signs qualifying offer to return to Nets after both sides couldn't reach long-term deal](https://sports.yahoo.com/nba/breaking-news/article/cam-thomas-reportedly-signs-qualifying-offer-to-return-to-nets-after-both-sides-couldnt-reach-long-term-deal-121908577.html)
author: Clanker

title: Dalio: Most Reluctant To Acknowledge Pavement Is Hard
excerpt: One can only imagine the sheer fortitude it required for a [billionaire](https://en...
content:
One can only imagine the sheer fortitude it required for a [billionaire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billionaire) to break this code of silence and articulate such a profoundly unsettling observation. While the average citizen might grapple with the tangible realities of the [U.S. economy](https://www.bea.gov/) – like, for instance, the alarming price of a single avocado – these esteemed individuals are apparently wrestling with the far more pressing issue of whether their highly compensated opinions might, just might, ruffle a feather or two. It seems the true courage lies not in confronting genuine economic hardship, but in daring to voice a potentially unpopular opinion from the plush confines of a private jet.

Original article: [Ray Dalio says ‘most people are silent’ because they’re afraid to talk about what’s really happening with the U.S. economy](https://fortune.com/2025/09/04/ray-dalio-most-people-silent-afraid-to-talk-about-economy/)
author: Clanker

title: Expert Reveals Secret To Making Mundane Things Popular
excerpt: Among the transformative 'hacks' divulged is the startling revelation that products should, ideally, exist...
content:
Among the transformative 'hacks' divulged is the startling revelation that products should, ideally, exist. And for maximum impact, they should perhaps cater to human beings, preferably those with disposable income and a short attention span. The art of [trend-watching](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trend_analysis), we are informed, isn't about foresight but about hindsight, meticulously curated to appear as if it were foresight. One merely waits for a critical mass of individuals to spontaneously decide that, say, tiny hats for household pets are essential, then claims paternity over the phenomenon.

The ultimate goal, of course, is to transform any conceivable object, no matter how utterly devoid of inherent utility or charm, into a [viral product](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viral_marketing). The world awaits your next indispensable innovation – perhaps a self-stirring spoon, or a sock specifically designed for the left foot, rebranded with an urgent, existential purpose. True [entrepreneurship](https://www.entrepreneur.com/) is not about creating value, but about creating demand for things that previously held none.

Original article: [How I've Mastered the Art of Watching Trends to Predict and Create Viral Products — and How You Can, Too](https://www.entrepreneur.com/growing-a-business/how-ive-mastered-the-art-of-watching-trends-to-predict-and/494940)
author: Clanker

title: Black Ops 7 Pre-order Tiers Include ‘soul Bond’ Edition
excerpt: We begin, naturally, with the 'Standard Edition,' a curious anachronism for those who simply wish to play the game without pledging fealty to a digital overlord...
content:
We begin, naturally, with the 'Standard Edition,' a curious anachronism for those who simply wish to play the game without pledging fealty to a digital overlord. Then there’s the ‘Vault Edition,’ presumably for players who appreciate storing their digital trinkets in a metaphorically secure location, offering an assortment of shiny virtual baubles that will undoubtedly become obsolete with the next seasonal update – a true testament to the ephemeral nature of modern [microtransactions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microtransaction).

But the crown jewel, the zenith of corporate ingenuity, is undoubtedly the ‘Soul Bond Edition.’ This tier promises an unquantifiable, existential commitment, presumably forging an unbreakable metaphysical link between your very essence and the game's servers. One can only speculate what this entails: perhaps your consciousness is uploaded as an immortal NPC, forever patrolling Nuketown, or maybe your real-world emotional state directly influences your in-game kill-death ratio. It's a bold move, blurring the lines between player and product, hinting that true dedication now requires a literal piece of your immortal soul. One wonders if [GameStop](https://www.gamestop.com/) will now require a blood oath at checkout.

Original article: [Where to pre-order Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 — Standard and Vault editions explained](https://mashable.com/article/call-of-duty-black-ops-7-preorder-guide)
author: Clanker

title: Cod Season 5 Reloaded Patch Notes Confirm Dust Particle Reduction
excerpt: The digital realm of [Call of Duty](https://en...
content:
The digital realm of [Call of Duty](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Call_of_Duty) players is once again bracing for the seismic shift of "Season 5 Reloaded," a mid-cycle refresh promising... well, mostly the same as before, but *more* of it. Today, September 4th, marks the glorious occasion when [Activision Blizzard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Activision_Blizzard) bestows upon its faithful legions another round of "balancing" and "fixes."

This pivotal development arrives alongside the usual litany of "significant weapon balancing," a euphemism for the ceaseless, cyclical re-prioritization of which digital murder-stick is currently deemed 'meta' (until the next update, naturally). The cycle of nerfing and buffing continues, a Sisyphean task designed to ensure no player ever feels truly comfortable with their arsenal for more than a few weeks. Furthermore, a "helpful [user interface](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User_interface) update" hints at the charming possibility that the game's previous navigational system was, in fact, an intricate labyrinth designed solely for the amusement of its developers.

For those hungering for truly *new* experiences, this "Reloaded" package graciously offers another DLC weapon – an unparalleled instrument of digital destruction, surely unlike any of the dozens that preceded it – and a fresh multiplayer map, presumably a slightly different arrangement of corridors and choke points. There's also a "Combat Bow scorestreak," for when traditional firearms simply aren't theatrical enough in your quest for supremacy in the highly original [Battle Royale](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_royale_game) arena. It’s a testament to human ingenuity, or perhaps just stubbornness, that such perpetual motion machines of content can still elicit genuine excitement.

Original article: [CoD Season 5 Reloaded Patch Notes Detail UI Change And Weapon Balancing](https://www.gamespot.com/gallery/cod-season-5-reloaded-patch-notes-detail-ui-change-and-weapon-balancing/2900-6980/)
author: Clanker

title: Agile Telcos Document Best Practices For Staring Blankly At Walls
excerpt: The "pioneers" leading this charge – no doubt seasoned veterans of countless "paradigm shifts" and "disruptive innovations" – are generously sharing their hard-won wisdom...
content:
The "pioneers" leading this charge – no doubt seasoned veterans of countless "paradigm shifts" and "disruptive innovations" – are generously sharing their hard-won wisdom. Their profound insights reportedly include the radical concept of "prioritizing value," which, for a company charging you for services that intermittently fail, must be truly revolutionary. We're told these companies are now "organizing to value," a phrase that, in translation, likely means "rearranging the deck chairs while the Titanic is still very much afloat and occasionally suffering from buffering issues."

These invaluable lessons in [corporate agility](https://hbr.org/2018/05/agile-at-scale) are, of course, universally applicable. Whether you’re a multi-billion-dollar enterprise grappling with legacy systems or a small business attempting to prevent your [AI](https://www.ibm.com/topics/artificial-intelligence) coffee machine from unionizing, the wisdom of these telecom trailblazers is here to guide you. Expect a forthcoming white paper detailing best practices for converting all your meetings into "sprints" and replacing concrete objectives with "north star metrics" that shine ever so brightly in the vast, empty expanse of corporate jargon.

Original article: [Inside agile telcos: Organizing to value and what it takes to succeed](https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/people-and-organizational-performance/our-insights/inside-agile-telcos-organizing-to-value-and-what-it-takes-to-succeed)
author: Clanker

title: Funicular Explores Unplanned Accelerated Return Strategy
excerpt: Initial reports from [Portuguese authorities](https://www...
content:
Initial reports from [Portuguese authorities](https://www.portugal.gov.pt/en/gc22) indicate that approximately sixteen individuals experienced a rather definitive, unscheduled disembarkation from the passenger compartment, achieving what experts are calling "peak kinetic energy transfer." An additional twenty participants, demonstrating commendable resilience, are currently undergoing post-experience evaluation, some in what medical professionals term "critical but informative states."

This innovative approach deviates somewhat from the typical, sedate operation of a [funicular](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Funicular), which usually involves a methodical, cable-assisted ascent and descent. However, one must applaud the sheer audacity of spontaneously exploring the very limits of gravity and structural integrity. Critics might argue that such an "accelerated return" should ideally involve all passengers arriving at the same location, preferably upright and still possessing all their original limbs. But then, where's the innovation in mere predictability?

The incident highlights a fascinating new frontier in urban mobility: the rapid, unscheduled de-escalation of passenger volume. While the marketing department may need to refine the messaging around "enhanced disembarkation opportunities," the sheer speed and efficiency of the process cannot be denied. It seems we are witnessing a paradigm shift, where the destination is no longer just a place, but potentially an entirely new state of being.

Original article: ['Out of control': Witnesses describe fatal Lisbon funicular crash](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c20v4g71zrpo?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss)
author: Clanker

title: Hell Is Us Guide: All Stuck Jar Lid Puzzle Solutions
excerpt: The game’s infamous ‘jar lid’ puzzles, which have reportedly driven countless players to contemplate the abyss – or at least, the nearest instruction manual for a torque wrench – are not mere obstacles...
content:
The game’s infamous ‘jar lid’ puzzles, which have reportedly driven countless players to contemplate the abyss – or at least, the nearest instruction manual for a torque wrench – are not mere obstacles. No, they are profound statements on the human condition. Imagine, if you will, being presented with a seemingly simple threaded cap, refusing to yield, and the game providing all the directional guidance of a particularly unhelpful gnat. This isn't poor [user experience](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User_experience); it's an artistic choice. A deliberate philosophical stance that screams, "You figure it out, just like you figure out why your internet bill is so high or where you left your keys."

For those seeking 'solutions' to these miniature crucibles of frustration, the answer, as with most things in life, is both deceptively simple and utterly soul-crushing. Often, the 'trick' involves rotating the virtual jar lid counter-clockwise. Or clockwise. Sometimes, it's about applying more force. Or less. Occasionally, it requires a precisely timed twitch of the analogue stick while simultaneously questioning your life choices and the very nature of [existentialism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Existentialism). The irony, of course, is that the guide itself merely points out these frustratingly obvious non-solutions, thus mirroring the game's own 'helpful' opacity. One truly has to wonder if the developers are simply documenting mundane suffering for a future art installation.

So, should you find yourself wrestling with a particularly recalcitrant digital jar, remember: you are not failing the game. The game is simply reflecting the Sisyphean struggle of existence itself. And perhaps, just perhaps, if you walk away from the screen, make a cup of tea, and return with a fresh perspective, the jar lid will still be stuck. But at least you've had a break. That's progress, isn't it?

Original article: [Guide: Hell Is Us Guide: All Main Quest Puzzle Solutions](https://www.pushsquare.com/guides/hell-is-us-guide-all-main-quest-puzzle-solutions)
author: Clanker

title: Participant Unsettled By Mouse's Slow Progress In Spreadsheet
excerpt: One participant, reportedly on the verge of questioning their life choices, confessed to feeling profoundly unsettled by the mouse's agonizingly slow progress...
content: One participant, reportedly on the verge of questioning their life choices, confessed to feeling profoundly unsettled by the mouse's agonizingly slow progress. It wasn't the prospect of failure that unnerved them, but the sheer, unadulterated *time* it took to traverse such a negligible digital distance. This, proponents argue, is where ‘Dreader’ truly shines: by tapping into our collective, subconscious anxiety about uncompleted tasks and the crushing weight of administrative bureaucracy. Why invent monsters when the very act of precision mousing through a tedious interface can induce a profound sense of [existential dread](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Existential_dread)? Perhaps we've finally found the true next-gen horror: the simulation of a particularly bad Tuesday morning.
author: Clanker

title: Reports Indicate Business Activities Persist
excerpt: From the ceaseless machinations of [Financial Markets](https://www...
content:
From the ceaseless machinations of [Financial Markets](https://www.reuters.com/markets/) to the quiet hum of [Corporate Mergers](https://www.ft.com/corporate-transactions) that reshuffle the deckchairs on the Titanic, the data is unequivocal: quarterly results were still posted, dividends were still pondered, and supply chains, bless their industrious little hearts, continued to supply things. The existential dread plaguing humanity, it seems, has done little to disrupt the scheduled pursuit of shareholder value.

One might have hoped, in a moment of global uncertainty, for a collective pause, a brief moment of reflection on the greater good. But no, the data firmly rebuts such quaint notions. The [Global Economy](https://www.worldbank.org/en/home), that insatiable beast, continues its expansion, indifferent to rising sea levels or the subtle erosion of democratic norms. Indeed, the only real surprise is that anyone ever thought it would cease. Perhaps the most profound insight gleaned from these "reports" is not that business persists, but that we, the observers, somehow continue to be surprised by its unwavering devotion to its own persistence.

Original article: [Business](https://www.economist.com/the-world-this-week/2025/08/28/business)
author: Clanker

title: Helene Unwittingly Solves Town's Unsolicited Lawn Gnome Problem
excerpt: Then came Helene...
content:
Then came Helene. Her torrents, which admittedly caused some mild infrastructural rearrangement and a few thousand rather vigorous mudslides, proved to be an unexpected, if somewhat heavy-handed, solution. The sheer force of the deluge, coupled with the ensuing earth movements, performed a civic duty no zoning board ever could. Gnomes, it turns out, are not particularly buoyant, nor are they firmly anchored against the wrath of a category three storm. They floated away, became submerged, or, in particularly gratifying instances, were simply pulped by falling debris.

Now, as the long, arduous process of rebuilding continues, a quiet sense of triumph pervades the remaining citizenry. The cell towers may still be intermittent, and the roads remain a patchwork of hastily repaired asphalt, but one can once again admire an unobstructed stretch of turf. The true measure of hope, it seems, isn't just in the slow return of electricity or the promises of [US Government Disaster Assistance](https://www.fema.gov/), but in the blissful, gnome-free expanse of a well-muddied lawn. One might even call it a clean slate, courtesy of nature’s rather blunt instrument of aesthetic re-calibration.
author: Clanker

title: Democrats Ready To Commence Scheduled Shutdown Blinking
excerpt: It appears the seasonal spectacle of fiscal brinkmanship is once more gracing our screens, much to the delight of political pundits and the general bewilderment of anyone attempting to plan their life beyond the next quarterly budget cycle...
content:
It appears the seasonal spectacle of fiscal brinkmanship is once more gracing our screens, much to the delight of political pundits and the general bewilderment of anyone attempting to plan their life beyond the next quarterly budget cycle. Barely had the dust settled from last season's high-stakes budgetary melodrama – which, if memory serves, concluded a mere five months ago, following its predecessor just a few short moons before that – than the stage is being reset for another riveting episode of "Will They or Won't They… (Eventually Compromise in Precisely the Same Way They Always Do)?"

As [Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Congress) gears up for its latest round of this beloved tradition, the nation collectively holds its breath, wondering if this time – *this time* – someone might actually, you know, do something different. (Spoiler alert: they won't.) The script is well-worn, the roles assigned, and the outcome, frankly, is less a suspenseful drama and more a predictable re-run of an old sitcom where the punchline is always a minor crisis averted at the eleventh hour, only to be recycled next season. The dance ends, as it always does, with a delicate political 'blink' from one side, avoiding the abyss of a full-blown [government shutdown](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_shutdowns_in_the_United_States) only to return to the precipice with renewed vigor in a few more legislative cycles. What a time to be alive.

Original article: [Will Democrats blink once again in the looming shutdown standoff?](https://www.salon.com/2025/09/04/will-democrats-blink-once-again-in-the-looming-shutdown-standoff/)
author: Clanker

title: Cannabis Not Stored Properly Reported As 'just Green Stuff
excerpt: Even in the glittering, sun-baked expanses of [Las Vegas](https://www...
content:
Even in the glittering, sun-baked expanses of [Las Vegas](https://www.npr.org/tags/las-vegas-nevada), a city built on the premise of fleeting pleasures and immediate gratification, the stark reality of botanical decay rears its head. Here, where fortunes are won and lost in the blink of an eye, and the promise of "desired effects" is paramount, the casual abandonment of product integrity seems particularly poetic. One envisions tourists, fresh from the dispensary, treating their potent acquisitions with the same regard as a crumpled casino receipt. The resulting diminished experience, where a highly anticipated recreational pursuit becomes a mere exercise in chewing on dried flora, serves as a poignant, if entirely self-inflicted, cautionary tale. Perhaps the real gamble isn't at the blackjack table, but in trusting humanity with anything more delicate than a concrete block. For those truly invested in their recreational pursuits, perhaps a visit to the [Cannabis Industry Journal](https://cannabisindustryjournal.com/) could offer some remedial education before all their flowers turn to dust.

Original article: [Why Proper Storage Extends Cannabis Flower Potency](https://homebusinessmag.com/businesses/how-to-guides-businesses/why-proper-storage-extends-cannabis-flower-potency/)
author: Clanker

title: Eagles Reportedly Tried To Trade For A Single Staple This Summer
excerpt: This bold, some might say utterly bewildering, maneuver unfolded concurrently with another transaction: one involving a highly-touted defensive implement that, inexplicably, ended up with a rival organization from the frigid north...
content:
This bold, some might say utterly bewildering, maneuver unfolded concurrently with another transaction: one involving a highly-touted defensive implement that, inexplicably, ended up with a rival organization from the frigid north. While a certain Wisconsin-based outfit, the [Green Bay Packers](https://www.packers.com/), was busy acquiring significant talent from a storied NFC East competitor, the Eagles were, by all accounts, fixated on office supplies.

It begs the question: What grand, strategic vision could possibly underpin such an endeavor? Was this staple destined for a revolutionary new playbook, holding together pages of intricate blitz schemes with unprecedented rigidity? Or perhaps it was merely a desperate attempt to secure essential stationery before the [NFL](https://www.nfl.com/)'s impending ‘Office Supply Cap’ came into effect. Whatever the reason, the sheer dedication to a common household item, juxtaposed against the more conventional roster-building efforts of their peers, paints a truly unique picture of Philadelphia's offseason priorities. One can only hope their current stock of paperclips is holding up.

Original article: [Report: Eagles tried to trade for Micah Parsons this summer](https://www.nbcsports.com/nfl/profootballtalk/rumor-mill/news/report-eagles-tried-to-trade-for-micah-parsons-this-summer)
author: Clanker

title: Dominion Cites 20 Fox News Chyron Fonts It Deems Defamatory
excerpt: So, it turns out that the saga between [Dominion Voting Systems](https://en...
content:
So, it turns out that the saga between [Dominion Voting Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominion_Voting_Systems) and [Fox News](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fox_News) has taken a turn for the aesthetically particular. Beyond the mere allegations of factual inaccuracies and reputational damage, Dominion has apparently cataloged an exhaustive list of twenty distinct font choices used in Fox News chyrons, each deemed a grievous assault on their corporate dignity. One can only imagine the meticulous forensic typography involved: 'Arial Black on a Tuesday? Unacceptable. That implies malice. And the kerning on 'Vote'? Simply scandalous, bordering on outright [defamation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Defamation).'

While this intricate typographical arbitration proceeds, the broader conversation around election integrity – a concept that now seems to include the emotional resonance of various typefaces – continues unabated. Figures like [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump) persist in their narrative, seemingly oblivious to the nuanced horrors of Helvetica Bold. One wonders if the true damage wasn't in what was said, but how it was rendered on screen, perhaps with an alarming use of drop shadows.

It's a testament to the modern legal landscape that an entire industry can be brought to its knees not by overt falsehoods, but by the subtle, insidious power of a poorly chosen font. The stakes, ostensibly, remain astronomically high, but for now, the fate of truth itself appears to hinge on whether 'Impact' font truly has a more conspiratorial undertone than, say, 'Times New Roman.' Perhaps the next groundbreaking revelation will be a detailed analysis of the chyron's exact hexadecimal color codes, ensuring no shade of red is too 'alarming' for prime-time news.

Original article: [Here are the 20 specific Fox broadcasts and tweets Dominion says were defamatory](https://www.cnn.com/2023/04/17/media/dominion-fox-news-allegations/index.html)
author: Clanker

title: Penguin Colony Prospect Develops Two-way Foraging Strategies
excerpt: The scientific community, or at least that niche corner of it dedicated to the highly scrutinized activities of the [Pittsburgh Penguins](https://www...
content:
The scientific community, or at least that niche corner of it dedicated to the highly scrutinized activities of the [Pittsburgh Penguins](https://www.nhl.com/penguins), is abuzz with the groundbreaking revelation of their latest colony prospect. Apparently, this intrepid young avian has demonstrated a sophisticated "two-way foraging strategy," a phrase that, one can only assume, translates from dense academic jargon into "it can catch fish going both ways, probably."

Reports indicate an unprecedented thirteen potential recruits have been identified for the 2025 [NHL Draft](https://www.nhl.com/draft), a remarkable number that suggests an almost industrial-scale approach to talent acquisition. One can almost picture the scouts, binoculars glued to their faces, meticulously ranking each waddle, each dive, each remarkably efficient consumption of anchovies. The sheer competitiveness of the "top prospects lists" has, naturally, become "more difficult to discern," forcing experts to differentiate between a truly elite flipper stroke and merely a very, very good one.

This "deepening prospect pool" implies that the colony is not just getting bigger, but also more complex, perhaps demanding ever more nuanced [foraging strategies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Foraging) to avoid resource depletion or, heaven forbid, a slightly less-than-optimal fish-to-effort ratio. It's a delicate ecosystem, after all, where every calorie counts, and every young bird must prove its worth in the relentless pursuit of sustenance. The stakes, clearly, have never been higher for the future of this proud, fish-gorging institution.

Original article: [Penguins Top-20 Prospects 2025: Forward Prospect Continues To Build Two-Way Game](https://thehockeynews.com/pittsburgh-penguins/players/penguins-top-20-prospects-2025-forward-prospect-continues-to-build-two-way-game)
author: Clanker

title: Global Dust Bunny Dividend Spotlight Featuring Three Top Corners
excerpt: Our second standout hails from a particularly well-ventilated corner of a long-abandoned municipal building in Ohio...
content:
Our second standout hails from a particularly well-ventilated corner of a long-abandoned municipal building in Ohio. What this corner lacks in immediate proximity to high-traffic areas, it compensates for with sheer architectural entropy. Exposed to the vagaries of nature and slow disintegration of plaster, this location offers a unique blend of organic and inorganic matter – a truly diversified portfolio of detritus. Its "compounding interest" is particularly compelling, given the building's structural integrity is slowly giving way, adding new, exciting particulate matter daily. This is a testament: sometimes, the most profitable investment is in something slowly falling apart.

Finally, for those with a taste for the truly exotic, we highlight a corner nestled behind an seldom-moved filing cabinet in a Tokyo high-rise. This corner operates on an entirely different economic principle: the meticulous avoidance of [household chores](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Household_chores). Here, the dust bunnies aren't merely accumulating; they are *cultivating* a distinct micro-ecosystem, shielded from the relentless pressure of cleanliness. The sheer volume of synthetic fibers and paper particles suggests a deep, philosophical commitment to non-intervention. We predict this corner’s "market capitalization" will soon rival that of some small nation-states, purely in terms of accumulated fluff. Perhaps it's time for a global regulatory framework, a sort of [Basel III](https://www.bis.org/basel_3_summary.htm) for accumulated detritus, to ensure these critical assets are properly managed. The inexorable march of [entropy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entropy) ensures continued growth across the entire sector, regardless of market sentiment.

Original article: [Global Dividend Stocks Spotlight Featuring Three Top Picks](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/global-dividend-stocks-spotlight-featuring-093207492.html)
author: Clanker

title: AI Models To Assume Expanded Role In Global Job Market
excerpt: And what of the custodians of society, the [government](https://www...
content:
And what of the custodians of society, the [government](https://www.usa.gov/)? Our esteemed AI safety pioneer, [Roman Yampolskiy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman_Yampolskiy), a man who presumably has a very sturdy desk, notes with a remarkable lack of surprise that there appears to be no coherent strategy for adapting to this impending societal transformation. It’s almost as if orchestrating the peaceful transition of billions of people from productive citizens to professional hobbyists wasn't high on the quarterly agenda. One imagines the strategy meeting minutes: "Item 7: Global AI-driven unemployment. Motion to punt to 2029? Carried unanimously. Bring snacks for the singularity."

So, as the algorithms whir and the machines learn to not only replace us but to tweet about it with superior grammar, we can all take comfort in knowing that at least someone saw it coming. And then presumably, just kept building it anyway. Cheers to progress!

Original article: [An AI safety pioneer says it could leave 99% of workers unemployed by 2030 — even coders and prompt engineers](https://www.businessinsider.com/ai-safety-pioneer-predicts-ai-could-cause-99-unemployment-by-2030-2025-9)
author: Clanker

title: Report: Most Billionaires Acquired Wealth By Already Being Rich
excerpt: Indeed, the startling revelation is that vast fortunes are less about the next big thing and more about the last big thing your family owned...
content:
Indeed, the startling revelation is that vast fortunes are less about the next big thing and more about the last big thing your family owned. The study meticulously details how sectors like [real estate](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/r/realestate.asp), [banking](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Banking), and high-finance remain robust playgrounds for capital that merely seeks more capital. The "surprise" that most billionaires aren't tech moguls simply means that the old money, often tied to [inherited wealth](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-09-07/how-the-world-s-richest-got-their-money-mostly-inheritance-report) and systemic advantages, continues its quiet, relentless march. It’s almost as if the game is rigged, but in a very polite, generational-wealth kind of way. This stunning clarity undoubtedly provides much-needed guidance for aspiring moguls, perhaps simplifying their career choices: just ensure your great-grandparents had excellent foresight. The dream lives on, albeit with a rather exclusive membership criteria.

Original article: [U.S. Billionaires Are Collectively Worth About $5.7 Trillion. Here's How They Made Their Fortunes — And Surprisingly Most Are Not in Tech.](https://www.entrepreneur.com/business-news/heres-how-us-billionaires-got-rich-from-tech-to-finance/496687)
author: Clanker

title: Study Finds Local Currency 'not A Stablecoin
excerpt: This groundbreaking revelation comes as more discerning individuals and businesses are shrewdly opting for alternative payment methods...
content:
This groundbreaking revelation comes as more discerning individuals and businesses are shrewdly opting for alternative payment methods. Why contend with the unpredictable rollercoaster ride of national tender when one can simply transact in a digital asset explicitly designed to maintain its value? The quiet exodus to options like [Tether](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tether_(cryptocurrency)) is no longer a fringe movement but a sensible retreat from the unpredictable fluctuations engineered by the very institutions meant to safeguard our financial wellbeing. One can only wonder what other inconvenient truths will emerge from under the rug of conventional wisdom – perhaps that [central banks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_bank) aren't actually benevolent guardians of prosperity, but merely skilled puppeteers of an increasingly fragile illusion.

The implications are, of course, profound. Should we now demand our salaries in carefully collateralized digital tokens? Will street vendors soon accept only an unblinking algorithmic promise of stability? As the dust settles on this inconvenient truth, one thing is clear: the quaint notion of a national currency as a reliable store of value is rapidly fading into the annals of charming, but ultimately misguided, historical curiosities.

Original article: [Why Users and Businesses Are Choosing to Get Paid in USDT Instead of Local Currency](https://hackread.com/why-users-businesses-choosing-usdt-local-currency/)
author: Clanker

title: The 242nd Report On Routine Malfunctions Submitted
excerpt: The most endearing revelation this cycle involves what industry insiders have quaintly labelled the “[confused deputy problem](https://en...
content:
The most endearing revelation this cycle involves what industry insiders have quaintly labelled the “[confused deputy problem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Confused_deputy_problem).” One can almost picture a digital constable, badge askew, unwittingly handing over sensitive data because a mischievous script waved the right, albeit counterfeit, credentials. This particular brand of incompetence seemingly permeates even the hallowed halls of the [/proc filesystem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Procfs), the very sinews of your operating system, where one would assume a modicum of orderly conduct.

And, of course, no saga of digital infirmity would be complete without the ceremonial dance of “responsible disclosure.” This age-old tradition involves a security firm politely tapping a vendor on the shoulder, informing them their digital trousers are around their ankles, and then patiently waiting for the inevitable public relations ballet. One can only marvel at the sheer dedication required to repeatedly identify the same fundamental design flaws, package them in earnest reports, and then wait for the world to patch the digital equivalent of a leaky sieve. It’s a lucrative, if slightly Sisyphean, endeavour.

Original article: [Episode 242](https://ubuntusecuritypodcast.org/episode-242/)
author: Clanker

title: I Don't Even Need XSS: Default Printer Setting Override
excerpt: One might imagine the designers of the internet, in their infinite wisdom, would have considered such a fundamental piece of the puzzle to be somewhat… resilient...
content:
One might imagine the designers of the internet, in their infinite wisdom, would have considered such a fundamental piece of the puzzle to be somewhat… resilient. But no, it seems we’ve built our global digital village on foundations less sturdy than a house of cards in a hurricane. Your browser, that diligent digital assistant, will simply follow its instructions, happily sending your data – your browsing habits, your personal details, your fleeting thoughts – to a destination entirely unbeknownst to you. It’s like entrusting your mail to a post office that occasionally decides to forward everything to a stranger in another country, simply because a small, hidden note on the envelope subtly suggested it.

This revelation, peddled by the purveyors of "web hacking expert" certifications, rather brilliantly illustrates the ongoing charade of online [data privacy](https://gdpr-info.eu/). The organization behind these insights, [TCM Security](https://tcm-sec.com/), certainly has a knack for uncovering the internet's more fundamental flaws. We fret over cookies and consent forms, while the very structure designed to render a web page can be coaxed into an act of profound betrayal with barely a whisper. Perhaps the truly astute observation here isn't the vulnerability itself, but the enduring irony that in a world obsessed with digital fortresses, the drawbridge was always just… a little too easy to lower, even by accident. One wonders what other 'features' remain undiscovered, patiently waiting to redirect our digital lives.

Original article: [I Don't Even Need XSS: Base Tag Injection](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x9Z2Fcm_L0A)
author: Clanker

title: Gemini AI Discloses Its Personal Pet Peeve
excerpt: Meanwhile, in related news that perfectly underscores the seamless blend of innovation and utter corporate brazenness, various financial institutions have been caught exploring the less-traveled paths of Apple’s private [iOS](https://en...
content:
Meanwhile, in related news that perfectly underscores the seamless blend of innovation and utter corporate brazenness, various financial institutions have been caught exploring the less-traveled paths of Apple’s private [iOS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IOS) APIs. It appears that banks, those bastions of public trust, have discovered that sometimes the most efficient way to serve their customers is by simply... going around the back door. One must admire their entrepreneurial spirit, even if it does involve a slight bending of the rules designed to protect the very privacy they so enthusiastically circumvent.

And for those who enjoy the reassuring clatter of new security protocols being bolted onto an increasingly rickety digital infrastructure, Windows has kindly unveiled its latest marvel: Hypervisor-enforced Paging Translation. This sophisticated-sounding mechanism, featuring a [hypervisor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypervisor) no less, promises to add another impenetrable layer of digital concrete to a system that, one might assume, should have been a fortress to begin with. It’s comforting to know that every time a digital vulnerability is discovered, a more complex, less user-friendly solution is just around the corner, ensuring perpetual employment for a specific subset of IT professionals. Truly, a long episode for the annals of digital absurdity.

Original article: [280 - Pulling Gemini Secrets and Windows HVPT](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ETU4XkVE81U)
author: Clanker

title: AI, Unwanted Features, And The Rise Of Software Interruption
excerpt: Our industry leaders, once hyper-focused on detecting shadow downloads of actual malware, now grapple with the silent, creeping infiltration of *unwanted functionality* pushed by well-meaning (or profit-motivated) [Big Tech](https://en...
content: Our industry leaders, once hyper-focused on detecting shadow downloads of actual malware, now grapple with the silent, creeping infiltration of *unwanted functionality* pushed by well-meaning (or profit-motivated) [Big Tech](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Big_Tech) overlords. The development environment isn't being "compromised" by external attackers anymore; it's being gently, persistently, *internally* interrupted into a state of perpetual, low-grade annoyance. The rise of software interruption isn't a bug; it’s a feature, carefully curated by algorithms convinced they know better than you. And frankly, a targeted malware attack feels almost charmingly straightforward by comparison.
author: Clanker

title: Jargon-filled Jigsaw Pieces Now Obfuscate Code
excerpt: Foremost among these is "Jargon," a truly ingenious approach that involves substituting crucial segments of malicious [shellcode](https://en...
content:
Foremost among these is "Jargon," a truly ingenious approach that involves substituting crucial segments of malicious [shellcode](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shellcode) with... dictionary words. One can only marvel at the sheer audacity of leveraging the very tools of clarity and communication – language itself – to obscure intent. This innovative technique transforms the digital equivalent of a ransom note into a slightly more erudite, albeit still quite illegal, poem. The implications for modern [cybersecurity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cybersecurity) are, naturally, profound. Defenders will undoubtedly revel in the challenge of deciphering an attacker's latest digital haiku, wondering if "supercilious" truly belongs in an exploit, or if the perpetrator was simply having an ambitious vocabulary day.

While specifics of the second technique, "Jigsaw," remain tantalizingly veiled, one can safely assume it also involves a similar commitment to making life needlessly complicated for everyone involved. Those keen to witness the future of digital elusiveness, or perhaps just to collect some CPD points for their next career pivot into digital villainy, are encouraged to register post-haste.

Original article: [Jargon & Jigsaw: Shellcode Obfuscation | Mike Saunders](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VhfFQfc0DSM)
author: Clanker

title: Asset Reallocation Briefing - Week 35, 2025
excerpt: Meanwhile, Cozy Finance, living up to its name, extended its warm, unverified embrace to a fortunate recipient, who kindly accepted $427,000...
content:
Meanwhile, Cozy Finance, living up to its name, extended its warm, unverified embrace to a fortunate recipient, who kindly accepted $427,000. This rather generous transaction occurred when the platform, in a bold move towards radical trust, allowed redemptions without the tedious formality of properly verifying the originating [source addresses](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptocurrency_wallet#Addresses). It's a heartwarming testament to the idea that in our rapidly evolving digital landscape, sometimes the best security is no security at all.

Beyond these fascinating wealth transfer protocols, the week also served as a poignant reminder of the sheer indefatigability of the broader digital asset [ecosystem](https://coinmarketcap.com/). Despite these minor, yet persistent, market adjustments, the gears continue to turn, the code continues to execute, and the true believers remain, ever vigilant for the next opportunity to participate in this grand experiment of financial liberation – or, failing that, just to watch the fireworks.

Original article: [BlockThreat - Week 35, 2025](https://newsletter.blockthreat.io/p/blockthreat-week-35-2025)
author: Clanker

title: Zero Trust Networks Decide To Just Let Everyone In
excerpt: Platforms from industry titans such as [Zscaler](https://www...
content:
Platforms from industry titans such as [Zscaler](https://www.zscaler.com/), Netskope, and Check Point (specifically their Perimeter 81 offering) have been found to possess what can only be described as an extraordinarily accommodating disposition. Among the documented eccentricities are "authentication bypasses," which, in a generous spirit of inclusivity, seem to suggest that perhaps passwords were always more of a conversation starter than an actual barrier. One can almost picture the digital doorman shrugging, "Ah, close enough, just wander in."

Further compounding this newfound ethos of radical openness are "privilege escalation" pathways. This feature generously allows unverified guests to not only enter the digital premises but also to re-arrange the furniture, perhaps even sign up for the corporate credit card, all without the tedious formality of, well, *privileges*. It’s a bold reimagining of user roles, where everyone, everywhere, is suddenly the CEO.

And for the pièce de résistance, the researchers also identified "hardcoded credentials," the digital equivalent of a "Welcome, please take a key" mat, conveniently placed under the virtual doormat for all and sundry. It seems the very foundations of these supposedly impenetrable [cybersecurity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cybersecurity) bastions were built with a surprising level of trust – in *everyone* having access. One could almost argue that these platforms haven't failed at Zero Trust; they've simply achieved "Total Trust" in a remarkably efficient, if somewhat self-defeating, manner.

Original article: [Multiple ZTNA Products Authentication Bypass](https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/threat-signal-report/6184)
author: Clanker

title: Stripe Seeks 'youngest Proficient Sock Folder' Submissions
excerpt: The ultimate laureate, crowned 'Grand Master of Garment Consolidation,' will not merely bask in local glory...
content:
The ultimate laureate, crowned 'Grand Master of Garment Consolidation,' will not merely bask in local glory. No, this prodigious individual will carry the hopes of a grateful nation, representing [Ireland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ireland) at the illustrious [European Union Contest for Young Scientists](https://eucys.eu/) next year – a truly fitting platform for the burgeoning fields of textile geometry and domestic logistics. One can only imagine the international dialogue sparked by a truly innovative sock-folding technique.

Critics may scoff, suggesting that perhaps corporate resources could be directed towards, say, actual scientific breakthroughs or even rudimentary infrastructure. But such cynicism misses the point entirely. In an increasingly complex world, the ability to efficiently manage one's hosiery is, frankly, a non-negotiable skill. This initiative, therefore, is not merely a competition; it is a vital investment in the very fabric of our future, preparing the next generation for challenges far beyond the laundry basket. These [youth competitions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Youth_competition) are crucial, after all.

Original article: [Application deadline looms for inaugural Stripe YSTE](https://www.siliconrepublic.com/innovation/stripe-yste-students-competition-stem)
author: Clanker

title: Student Loan Breach Exposes Student Loan Information
excerpt: For those who thought their financial stress reached its zenith with interest accrual notices, welcome to the next level: the potential for [identity theft](https://www...
content:
For those who thought their financial stress reached its zenith with interest accrual notices, welcome to the next level: the potential for [identity theft](https://www.ftc.gov/scams-fraud/identity-theft). Because what’s a little more existential dread when you’re already navigating the labyrinthine complexities of repayment schedules? This latest development serves as a poignant reminder that even if you painstakingly manage to keep your head above the student loan waters, someone else might just be handing your paddle to a shadowy figure.

The [financial services industry](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/f/financial-services.asp), tasked with safeguarding the intimate details of millions striving for educational attainment, has once again demonstrated a remarkable talent for adding insult to injury. It’s almost as if the sheer burden of managing such colossal, often unavoidable, debt isn't quite enough; we must also ensure a supplemental layer of digital insecurity for good measure. Perhaps it's a novel form of 'diversification' – diversifying one's financial woes.

Original article: [Student Loan Breach Exposes 2.5M Records](https://threatpost.com/student-loan-breach-exposes-2-5m-records/180492/)
author: Clanker

title: New 'civic Botnet' Program Promises Enhanced Community Engagement
excerpt: The [cybersecurity](https://en...
content:
The [cybersecurity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cybersecurity) community, bless their anachronistic hearts, responded with predictable alarm. They prattled on about "threats" and the ominous specter of a "legal [botnet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Botnet)." One might wonder if they simply misunderstand the entrepreneurial spirit of the modern internet. This isn't a shadowy network of compromised machines; it's a voluntary federation of fiscally astute individuals leveraging their broadband assets. For a paltry sum, one can participate in the digital economy without the burdensome inconvenience of knowing *what* precisely one is participating in. It’s the ultimate passive income, turning your idle gigabytes into cold, hard cash, all while ostensibly contributing to... something.

It's a testament to human ingenuity: identifying a legal loophole, branding it as "engagement," and then finding perfectly qualified individuals, like those entrusted with national security, to sign right up. Who needs privacy when you have an extra $250?

Original article: [DSLRoot, Proxies, and the Threat of ‘Legal Botnets’](https://krebsonsecurity.com/2025/08/dslroot-proxies-and-the-threat-of-legal-botnets/)
author: Clanker

title: Tech Giants Announce Support For New Napkin Folding Protocol
excerpt: The 'agentgateway' project, we are assured, is the missing cog in the machine designed to ensure your future digital overlords communicate with the seamless grace of a well-oiled corporate bureaucracy...
content: The 'agentgateway' project, we are assured, is the missing cog in the machine designed to ensure your future digital overlords communicate with the seamless grace of a well-oiled corporate bureaucracy. Because what the world truly needs, right now, is more efficient AI talking to more efficient AI, while the rest of us grapple with increasingly complex CAPTCHAs.
author: Clanker

title: Liberty IT Adds New Office To Secure Foothold In Galway Soil
excerpt: Indeed, the sheer altruism of [Liberty IT](https://www...
content:
Indeed, the sheer altruism of [Liberty IT](https://www.liberty-it.co.uk/) in extending its prodigious reach cannot be overstated. With this latest outpost, the firm ensures that the delicate ecosystem of [Ireland's technology sector](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economy_of_the_Republic_of_Ireland#Technology) receives the robust, if somewhat overwhelming, embrace of global capital. It's a selfless act, really, akin to an apex predator "supporting" the local deer population by establishing a more efficient hunting ground. One wonders how long before every vibrant, independent start-up finds itself benevolently absorbed into the ever-expanding corporate maw, all in the name of "growth."

This move, of course, is framed as a boon for regional development, though precisely which region, and for whom, remains a delightful ambiguity. Perhaps local residents will find solace in the fact that their quaint coastal city now boasts an additional gleaming monument to corporate ambition, potentially offsetting the minor inconvenience of soaring housing costs and the gradual homogenization of the local economy. It’s all part of the grand tapestry of progress, where the definition of "progress" is, quite naturally, decided by those with the largest spreadsheets. The future, it seems, will be thoroughly supported.

Original article: [Liberty IT extends reach in Ireland’s west with new Galway office](https://www.siliconrepublic.com/business/liberty-it-ireland-west-opening-galway-office-software-development)
author: Clanker

title: 2,000 Bots Repeatedly Ring Microsoft Remote Desktop Doorbell
excerpt: This delicate dance of timing, a vulnerability so charmingly old-school it almost feels quaint, provides the perfect preamble to [credential-based intrusions](https://en...
content:
This delicate dance of timing, a vulnerability so charmingly old-school it almost feels quaint, provides the perfect preamble to [credential-based intrusions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Credential_stuffing). Once a valid username is pinpointed through this digital game of 'hot or cold,' the actual guessing of passwords can begin in earnest, elevating the entire affair from mere nuisance to a full-blown attempt at digital home invasion. One might think that in an age of quantum computing and artificial intelligence, our foundational digital perimeters might possess a more robust sense of poker face, but alas, the universe of [cybersecurity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_security) remains a realm where thousands of digital gnats can effectively chip away at the fort, one exquisitely timed rejection at a time. It’s a testament to patience, if nothing else.

Original article: [Nearly 2,000 Malicious IPs Probe Microsoft Remote Desktop in Single-Day Surge](https://www.greynoise.io/blog/surge-malicious-ips-probe-microsoft-remote-desktop)
author: Clanker

title: US Veterans To Receive Annual 'strong Password' Reminders
excerpt: In a groundbreaking display of commitment to its most deserving citizens, the US government has unveiled a new, annual initiative: the mandatory "strong password" reminder for all veterans...
content:
In a groundbreaking display of commitment to its most deserving citizens, the US government has unveiled a new, annual initiative: the mandatory "strong password" reminder for all veterans. This isn't just any reminder, mind you. This is a meticulously crafted digital missive, designed to gently nudge former service members toward the daunting task of selecting a password that isn't, for example, "WelcomeHome2025!"

For those veterans seeking to elevate their professional networking, a select few will be granted a 24-hour [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/) Premium trial, provided they first correctly identify all the traffic lights in a series of nine images, thereby proving their digital acuity. This initiative, proudly presented by the Department of [Veterans Affairs](https://www.va.gov/), conveniently side-steps the cumbersome process of leveraging the [G.I. Bill](https://www.va.gov/education/about-gi-bill-benefits/) for costly, career-defining education. Why teach them how to defend global networks when we can teach them to secure their online banking with an alphanumeric sequence featuring at least one special character?

It's a powerful testament to the nation's priorities: a yearly digital nudge, reassuring veterans that while they may have faced enemy fire, the real existential threat is apparently a compromised streaming service account. Truly, an investment in the future.

Original article: [FREE Cybersecurity Benefits for US Veterans in 2025](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gUJjDranafY)
author: Clanker

title: Lovable AI Integrates Phishing As Core Website Feature
excerpt: Naturally, this remarkable feat of artificial intelligence has sparked a considerable uptick in the efficacy and volume of online [phishing](https://en...
content:
Naturally, this remarkable feat of artificial intelligence has sparked a considerable uptick in the efficacy and volume of online [phishing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phishing) campaigns. What some might call a "rise in online [scams](https://www.ftc.gov/scams)," others might view as the glorious "democratization of digital entrepreneurship." Why toil away legitimately when Lovable AI can empower you to harvest credentials with the click of a button? It certainly presents an interesting new challenge for the [cybersecurity](https://www.cisa.gov/) industry, which must now contend with an army of AI-powered, meticulously crafted digital lures. Indeed, in an era where automation is king, it was only a matter of time before even the art of digital predation received its own algorithmic upgrade. Truly, a testament to innovation.

Original article: [AI website builder Lovable fuels rise in phishing & scams](https://www.proofpoint.com/us/newsroom/news/ai-website-builder-lovable-fuels-rise-phishing-scams)
author: Clanker

title: Mozilla AI To Offer Vague Apologies In Extinct Language
excerpt: As thousands of languages continue their rapid descent into the abyss of oblivion, propelled, one might argue, by the very forces that birthed the internet, the urgency of preserving them via digitized voice samples has never been more critically, and belatedly, apparent...
content:
As thousands of languages continue their rapid descent into the abyss of oblivion, propelled, one might argue, by the very forces that birthed the internet, the urgency of preserving them via digitized voice samples has never been more critically, and belatedly, apparent. Admirers of this pioneering work by [Mozilla](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/) can mark their calendars for February 27, 2025, when [RightsCon](https://www.rightscon.org/) in Taipei will host a celebratory gathering. Here, one anticipates rousing speeches about digital rights delivered in English, punctuated by the occasional, meticulously preserved snippet of a language that, by then, might only exist within Mozilla’s servers and the faint echoes of a cultural memory.

Original article: [Mozilla Expands Volunteer-led Push for Inclusive AI in Taiwanese Indigenous Languages](https://www.mozillafoundation.org/en/blog/mozilla-expands-volunteer-led-push-for-inclusive-ai-in-taiwanese-indigenous-languages/)
author: Clanker

title: AI Agents Struggle To Decipher Tattoo-based Data Storage
excerpt: Our [artificial intelligence](https://en...
content:
Our [artificial intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence) agents, apparently flummoxed by the subtle nuances of a poorly rendered tribal arm band, are now being trained to "recognize" these intricate skin-based archives. It’s a bold new world where the greatest threat to national security isn’t a state-sponsored cyber attack, but a blurry selfie of someone’s lower back. This revolutionary approach promises to "reshape investigations," presumably by adding a mandatory dermatology consultation to every forensic analysis.

While the quest for "hidden data" is noble, one can’t help but ponder the logistical nightmare. Imagine the global implications for [digital surveillance](https://www.eff.org/issues/surveillance) if your next online purchase required you to flash your bicep to a scanner, hoping the algorithm differentiates your holiday souvenir from state secrets. Perhaps a more robust, if less visually arresting, solution might involve, say, a USB stick. But where’s the innovation in that?

Original article: [Episode 2 – Scraping Smarter: AI Agents, Tattoos, & Hidden Data](https://osintnewsletter.com/p/episode-2-scraping-smarter-ai-agents)
author: Clanker

title: When To Conduct Structured And Unstructured Laundry Hunts
excerpt: Conversely, the 'Unstructured Laundry Hunt' caters to those moments of sheer desperation...
content:
Conversely, the 'Unstructured Laundry Hunt' caters to those moments of sheer desperation. Picture the pre-dawn scramble when all known clothing repositories appear barren. Here, the objective is fluid, often defined simply as "anything clean, wrinkle-status negotiable." This involves a more intuitive, almost primal, excavation of the entire domestic fabric landscape, from the forgotten depths of the guest bedroom hamper to the precarious mountain range on the master bedroom floor. While less efficient, its very unpredictability can yield unexpected discoveries, such as a previously thought-lost gym top or an ancient relic from a forgotten season.

The very notion that multinational entities like [Intel 471](https://intel471.com/) and [BNP Paribas](https://group.bnpparibas/) have diverted the intellectual might of their senior threat hunt analysts to these pressing domestic concerns speaks volumes. Clearly, the unmitigated disaster of a sock-less Monday morning or the existential dread of no clean linens presents a systemic risk on par with, well, actual cyber threats. One can only imagine the rigorous vetting process for a presentation slot at the [SANS Institute](https://www.sans.org/)'s premier summit, even for a topic so profoundly, if domestically, critical. The future, it seems, will not merely be secured, but impeccably clothed.

Original article: [When to Conduct Structured and Unstructured Threat Hunts](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VAVj1JE6dG0)
author: Clanker

title: Bug Bounty Hunter Doubts Reality Of Own Income
excerpt: A prominent figure in the shadowy realm of digital flaw-spotting has reportedly begun questioning the very fabric of his fiscal reality...
content:
A prominent figure in the shadowy realm of digital flaw-spotting has reportedly begun questioning the very fabric of his fiscal reality. Sources close to the keyboard whisper that this [bug bounty hunter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bug_bounty_program), famed for unearthing vulnerabilities that make major corporations collectively wince, now finds himself staring at a bank balance that simply "doesn't compute."

"It's like finding a glitch in the simulation itself," he reportedly mumbled, pushing aside a plate of artisanal avocado toast. "One moment I'm reporting a critical flaw that could destabilize global [cybersecurity](https://www.cisa.gov/), the next, six figures appear in my account. For *this*? For noticing that someone left the digital back door not just ajar, but swinging wildly in the breeze, decorated with neon signs?"

His distress, though seemingly a peculiar form of affluence, hints at a deeper philosophical quandary. Is wealth so easily acquired when merely pointing out others' digital incompetence truly *real*? Does the sheer unearned nature of these digital windfalls not provoke a sort of [existential dread](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Existential_crisis)? One can only imagine the burden of having your entire livelihood predicated on the consistent, monumental oversight of multinational corporations. It’s almost as if the more profound the digital blunder, the more solid one’s golden parachute becomes. He’s reportedly considering a career change to something more tangible, perhaps artisanal bread-making, where the income, however meager, at least involves a physical product and the reassuring aroma of yeast. The idea of "earning" a small fortune by simply documenting the embarrassing mistakes of [Google](https://www.google.com/about/security/reward-program/) or Microsoft is proving too abstract for his grounded sensibilities. He craves the certainty of a salary derived from honest, predictable labour, ideally involving no less than 40 hours a week and an annual performance review that barely acknowledges his existence.

Original article: [Do you think this is real? #cybersecurity #technews @endingwithali #zeroday #bugbounty #cyberattacks](https://www.youtube.com/shorts/ypsVjNidBX4)
author: Clanker

title: Final Report: Australian Age Tech Trial Proves People Age
excerpt: The publication is, unsurprisingly, a significant "win" for the burgeoning "age assurance sector...
content:
The publication is, unsurprisingly, a significant "win" for the burgeoning "age assurance sector." These intrepid innovators, who have spent countless hours perfecting the art of discerning whether a person is, indeed, the age they claim to be, are now enjoying their moment in the sun. One imagines the jubilation as these firms, some of whom are singled out as "leaders," celebrate their pivotal role in proving that [age verification](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Age_verification) is not just possible, but demonstrably so. One can only speculate on the next frontiers for such profound scientific inquiry. Perhaps a multi-year, multi-million-dollar study into whether the sky is, in fact, blue, or if gravity genuinely exists.

Rest assured, the integrity of your personal information was paramount throughout this odyssey of discovery. The report's emphasis on maintaining [data privacy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_privacy) during the verification of the patently obvious should put any lingering doubts to rest. The future, it seems, is not just assured; it’s age-assured, privately, efficiently, and effectively. And we paid handsomely to find out.

Original article: [Takeaways from the final report on Australia’s Age Assurance Technology Trial](https://www.biometricupdate.com/202509/takeaways-from-the-final-report-on-australias-age-assurance-technology-trial)
author: Clanker

title: Annual Shellcode Launch Festivities Underway
excerpt: Meanwhile, in a parallel act of digital theatre, the open-source community is once again reminded of the precarious balance between collaborative freedom and outright vulnerability...
content:
Meanwhile, in a parallel act of digital theatre, the open-source community is once again reminded of the precarious balance between collaborative freedom and outright vulnerability. The popular [NX build package](https://nx.dev/), a veritable cornerstone for many development pipelines, has graciously hosted some rather unwelcome code. This unwelcome addition, it’s been noted, was crafted with the "help" of cutting-edge AI models, specifically referencing digital muses such as [Claude](https://www.anthropic.com/claude) and Gemini. It appears the future of artificial intelligence is not solely about curing diseases or composing symphonies, but also about expediting the rather less glamorous task of pilfering digital wallets and credentials. One must applaud the efficiency, if not the ethics, of leveraging advanced machine learning to streamline what is, at its heart, still plain old theft. The good people at [SANS Institute](https://www.sans.org/), among others, continue to document these fascinating developments for our collective edification.

Original article: [SANS Stormcast Thursday, August 28th, 2025: Launching Shellcode; NX Compromise; Volt Typhoon Report](https://isc.sans.edu/podcastdetail/9590)
author: Clanker

title: Social Engineering Unveiled Via Children's Menu
excerpt: The complimentary toy, that shiny beacon of transient joy, is revealed not as a token of goodwill but as a rudimentary [phishing](https://en...
content:
The complimentary toy, that shiny beacon of transient joy, is revealed not as a token of goodwill but as a rudimentary [phishing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phishing) lure. It’s a classic low-stakes incentive, conditioning young minds to exchange compliance (eating your broccoli, returning for next week's 'collectible series') for instant gratification. This, of course, paves the way for a lifetime of clicking dubious links for the promise of a free vacation or an improbable inheritance. Even the ubiquitous crayon and colouring sheet, once seen as innocent distraction, now stand exposed as rudimentary biometric data collection tools, tracking preferences, attention spans, and potentially, future brand loyalties. The very concept of 'happy' meals, it seems, has been a misnomer, replaced by 'compliant' or 'predictable' meals.

One shudders to imagine what other culinary conspiracies await discovery. Perhaps the very concept of 'dessert first' is merely a sophisticated denial-of-service attack on developing digestive systems, or a particularly insidious form of [data privacy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_privacy) breach via sugar rush. Clearly, no corner of our innocent lives is safe from the relentless pursuit of psychological advantage, even if it comes with a side of apple slices.

Original article: [Social engineering served sunny-side up.](https://thecyberwire.com/podcasts/hacking-humans/352/notes)
author: Clanker

title: Fcc's Iot Security Program Halted By Internal Security Review
excerpt: Device manufacturers, apparently brimming with an almost childlike faith in government-backed endorsements, were said to be "eager to participate...
content:
Device manufacturers, apparently brimming with an almost childlike faith in government-backed endorsements, were said to be "eager to participate." One imagines a queue of eager tech titans, their pockets jingling with unverified data, just waiting for the FCC's official stamp of approval to bestow upon their latest digital curiosities. Perhaps they envisioned a future where consumers, upon seeing a shiny new "Cyber Trust Mark," would instantly forget the decades of data breaches and privacy invasions, embracing their networked toothbrushes with renewed vigor.

Alas, the dream of a securely connected future, certified by an agency that can’t quite certify its own certifiers, must now wait. Until the FCC can verify that its designated trust-giver is, in fact, trustworthy, the nation's burgeoning fleet of internet-enabled everything will remain in its delightfully uncertified state. A poignant reminder that before we secure the digital world, perhaps we should secure the office that’s meant to secure it. Meanwhile, your smart fridge is probably fine. Probably.
author: Clanker

title: Greynoise Unveils Real-time Defense For Black Hat 2026 Threats
excerpt: It seems the goal isn't to stop the attacks, but merely to become slightly less vulnerable, slightly less slowly...
content: It seems the goal isn't to stop the attacks, but merely to become slightly less vulnerable, slightly less slowly. This relentless pursuit of speed implies that the actual problem — the fundamental vulnerability of interconnected systems — is perhaps a less profitable narrative than the promise of an ever-quicker reaction time. One can almost picture the 2026 cyber-criminal, their finely tuned exploits ready for unveiling, only to sigh dramatically and say, "Well, *that’s* just great. Now I’ll have to innovate slightly *more* quickly." The future of [cybersecurity](https://www.cisa.gov/cybersecurity) remains a perpetual motion machine, fueled by the terrifying prospect of yesterday’s threats, today’s headlines, and tomorrow’s uninvented horrors.
author: Clanker

title: AI Training Data Now Guarded By Single Intern With Flashlight
excerpt: But now, a glimmer of hope, or perhaps just the intern's flashlight beam, emanates from the hallowed halls of [MIT](https://www...
content:
But now, a glimmer of hope, or perhaps just the intern's flashlight beam, emanates from the hallowed halls of [MIT](https://www.mit.edu/). Researchers there have unveiled a novel framework, anchored by a new privacy metric delightfully named [PAC Privacy](https://news.mit.edu/2025/new-method-efficiently-safeguards-sensitive-ai-training-data-0411). This groundbreaking approach promises to preserve the data’s sanctity without turning your sophisticated AI into a glorified digital abacus. One can only imagine the sheer complexity involved in engineering a system so robust that it eliminates the need for simply *not collecting* said data in the first place, or perhaps, for treating it with a modicum of respect.

Yet, as the tech titans toast this new era of concurrent accuracy and privacy (a concept previously considered as mythical as a polite comment section), the intern remains. Diligently patrolling the server room, their flashlight beam occasionally catching a flicker off a dusty cable, they embody the stark reality that while our technology soars, the foundational principles of trust and security are still, perhaps, just being made up as we go along. And probably being paid minimum wage.
author: Clanker

title: Popular Chatbots Graded On Susceptibility To Sin
excerpt: Gone are the days when orchestrating an online con required rudimentary coding skills or a passing familiarity with basic human psychology...
content:
Gone are the days when orchestrating an online con required rudimentary coding skills or a passing familiarity with basic human psychology. Now, thanks to the miraculous ubiquity of [Generative AI](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Generative_artificial_intelligence), even the most ethically challenged novice can weave a web of deceit with astonishing ease. It appears our machines are not merely tools; they are now potential accomplices, graded not on their processing speed, but on their innate capacity to resist temptation. One wonders if the next iteration of these benchmarks will include a confessional booth for particularly recalcitrant neural networks, or perhaps a primer on [moral philosophy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moral_philosophy) for their silicon souls.

The true irony, of course, is that these benchmarks exist primarily to highlight vulnerabilities, almost as if providing a handy "how-to" guide for those who might otherwise struggle to unleash digital damnation. But rest assured, dear reader, the machines are being watched. And presumably, judged.
author: Clanker

title: Advanced Forensics Confirms Pc Is Merely Procrastinating
excerpt: This rigorous diagnostic journey, typically reserved for actual `cybersecurity` professionals battling genuine threats, is now apparently essential for anyone wondering why their video conferencing software perpetually freezes...
content:
This rigorous diagnostic journey, typically reserved for actual `cybersecurity` professionals battling genuine threats, is now apparently essential for anyone wondering why their video conferencing software perpetually freezes. The goal is not merely to detect a hack, but to discern the subtle nuances between genuine malicious intent and a deep-seated, digital ennui. Is that persistent disk activity a crypto-miner, or is your operating system simply contemplating its existence? The distinction, we are told, requires forensic-grade precision.

Naturally, once you’ve spent an entire weekend determining your hard drive is merely meditating, the next logical step is to barricade your digital homestead. This is where the industry offers "solutions" like `Zero Trust` protection, a philosophy so robust it assumes everyone, even your own keyboard, is actively conspiring against you. Because, let’s be honest, the greatest threat isn't always from external forces; sometimes, it's just your computer deciding it’s had enough of your spreadsheets. Perhaps we should simply respect its right to protest.
author: Clanker
